title: Self-signed TLS/SSL certificate
overview: <paragraph>The server's TLS/SSL certificate is self-signed. Self-signed certificates are not trusted by browsers and other HTTP clients, especially because TLS/SSL man-in-the-middle attacks typically use self-signed certificates to eavesdrop on TLS/SSL connections.</paragraph>
remediation: <paragraph>Create a new TLS/SSL certificate, request a trusted certificate authority (CA) to sign it and replace the self-signed certificate with the newly generated one.</paragraph>
